snippet: Delta Kappa Epsilon and its alumni organization filed the suit seeking a temporary injunction, saying the policy put in place by the Connecticut university in the name of equality was, in fact, discriminatory.
abstract: Delta Kappa Epsilon fraternity at Wesleyan University in Connecticut sues college, alleging school's directive that fraternities take steps to admit women in name of equality is, in fact, discriminatory; lawsuit argues that policy unfairly targets fraternities and that other forms of specialized housing are allowed.
lead_paragraph: Delta Kappa Epsilon and its alumni organization filed the suit seeking a temporary injunction, saying the policy put in place by the Connecticut university in the name of equality was, in fact, discriminatory.

headline.main: Fraternity Sues Wesleyan University Over Order to Admit Women
headline.print_headline: Fraternity Sues Wesleyan Over Order to Admit Women
